metadata.Title: CVE-2022-20568 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: In (TBD) of (TBD), there is a possible way to corrupt kernel memory due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-220738351References: Upstream kernel

notes.Note: alexmurray> Appears to only affect the upstream stable 5.10 kernel

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
